result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Solomon Wallace

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Solomon Wallace in court.  Attorney Colin Patrick McGinn in court for Solomon Wallace.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: K. Holmes - St Francis Police Officer. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 09.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Solomon Wallace not in court, in custody in MSDF.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms appeared by video for Solomon Wallace.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Defense informs the court that the defendant would like a Preliminary Hearing, Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Solomon Wallace not in court, in custody.  Abby Rockendorf in court, appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Status conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant to provide updated contact information to JusticePoint.

Defendant Solomon Wallace in court with attorney Haley E Wentz.  Defendant Solomon Wallace in custody.  Kimberly Dorice Schoepp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Solomon Wallace appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Van Grunsven, Branch 09. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
